metadata.name: PUA - Potential PE Metadata Tamper Using Rcedit
metadata.comment: Detects the use of rcedit to potentially alter executable PE metadata properties, which could conceal efforts to rename system utilities for defense evasion.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\rcedit-x64.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\rcedit-x86.exe'))) AND lower(device.desc) = lower('edit resources of exe') AND lower(metadata.product.name) = lower('rcedit') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('--set-')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('originalfilename')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('companyname')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('filedescription')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('productname')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('productversion')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('legalcopyright'))))

output.summary: Detects the use of rcedit to potentially alter executable PE metadata properties, which could conceal efforts to rename system utilities for defense evasion.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate use of the tool by administrators or users to update metadata of a binary References: https://security.stackexchange.com/questions/210843/is-it-possible-to-change-original-filename-of-an-exe, https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/02e8e8c5d430d8b768980f517b62d7792d690982b9ba0f7e04163cbc1a6e7915, https://github.com/electron/rcedit
